column4: I shall make myself at home in this room." So he stretched himself upon a couch. He lay there for a while lost in thought
column6: lo and behold! the table began to lay itself. When the cloth was spread
column7: all sorts of good cheer began to appear upon it. "Come what come may
column8: he thought to himself again, I am hungry." So he fell to and ate to his heart's content. When he had eaten all that he could swallow he threw himself upon the couch again and began to consider. Suddenly three women entered
column9: clothed entirely in black. One seated herself at the piano
column10: while the two others danced. Tired as he was
column11: when he saw this he arose and skipped about with them. After this entertainment they began to talk with him
column12: speaking of one thing and another
column13: and finally came round to the question how he might break the spell that bound them.
